message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a unique and valuable item that I think you'll really love. I'm willing to let it go for $180. What do you think?
I'm really interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $150. Can you meet me at that price?
I appreciate your interest in the product, Bob! However, I'm afraid I can't quite meet you at $150. I'm willing to compromise and meet you halfway, so I'm counteroffering at $165. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but I'm still a bit higher than $165. I'm willing to meet you at $155. Can you consider that?

I'm glad you're still interested in the product, Bob! I can see you're a serious buyer. I'm willing to make another concession, but I need to make a bit more profit. I'm counteroffering at $160. What do you think?
I'm still interested in the product, but I'm not willing to go above $155. I'm willing to meet you at that price. Can you accept it?

I understand you're still interested in the product, Bob, but I've already made some significant concessions. I'm willing to make one more offer, but I need to be closer to my minimum price. I'm counteroffering at $162.50. This is my final offer, so I hope you can meet me here.
I appreciate your final offer, but I'm still not comfortable with $162.50. I'm willing to meet you at $157.50. Can you consider it?

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting close to the end of our negotiation, Bob. I'm willing to make one last push to meet you in the middle. I'm counteroffering at $160, which is exactly halfway between our last two offers. This is my last offer, so I hope you can meet me here.
I appreciate your last offer, but I'm still not comfortable with $160. I'm willing to meet you at $155. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can agree on this price.
